verses.kjv: The word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.ct: This is the message that Isaiah son of Amoz received in a vision about Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in the last days, that the mountain of the LORD’s house shall be established in the top of the mountains, and shall be exalted above the hills; and all nations shall flow unto it.
verses.ct: In the final days, the mountain where the LORD's temple stands will be raised up as the highest of all mountains, towering above every hill, and every nation will stream toward it.

verses.kjv: And many people shall go and say, Come ye, and let us go up to the mountain of the LORD, to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths: for out of Zion shall go forth the law, and the word of the LORD from Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Crowds of people will come and say, 'Let's go up to the mountain of the LORD, to the temple of the God of Jacob. He will show us how to live, and we will follow his directions.' Because instruction will go out from Zion, and the LORD's message will spread from Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he shall judge among the nations, and shall rebuke many people: and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruninghooks: nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more.
verses.ct: He will settle disputes between nations and correct many peoples. They will hammer their swords into farming plows and reshape their spears into pruning tools. No nation will take up weapons against another, and they will never again train for war.

verses.kjv: O house of Jacob, come ye, and let us walk in the light of the LORD.
verses.ct: People of Jacob, come — let's live by the LORD's light!

verses.kjv: Therefore thou hast forsaken thy people the house of Jacob, because they be replenished from the east, and are soothsayers like the Philistines, and they please themselves in the children of strangers.
verses.ct: But you have abandoned your people, the house of Jacob, because they have filled themselves with Eastern practices, they consult fortune-tellers like the Philistines, and they embrace the customs of foreigners.

verses.kjv: Their land also is full of silver and gold, neither is there any end of their treasures; their land is also full of horses, neither is there any end of their chariots:
verses.ct: Their country overflows with silver and gold — their wealth has no limit. Their country is packed with horses — their chariots are beyond counting.

verses.kjv: Their land also is full of idols; they worship the work of their own hands, that which their own fingers have made:
verses.ct: Their country is also packed with idols. They bow down to objects their own hands crafted, things their own fingers shaped.

verses.kjv: And the mean man boweth down, and the great man humbleth himself: therefore forgive them not.
verses.ct: So everyone is degraded — both common people and important people humble themselves before idols. Do not forgive them!

verses.kjv: Enter into the rock, and hide thee in the dust, for fear of the LORD, and for the glory of his majesty.
verses.ct: Hide among the rocks and bury yourself in the ground, away from the terrifying presence of the LORD and the splendor of his majesty.

verses.kjv: The lofty looks of man shall be humbled, and the haughtiness of men shall be bowed down, and the LORD alone shall be exalted in that day.
verses.ct: The proud stares of humanity will be brought low, and human arrogance will be crushed. The LORD alone will be honored on that day.

verses.kjv: For the day of the LORD of hosts shall be upon every one that is proud and lofty, and upon every one that is lifted up; and he shall be brought low:
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies has reserved a day against everyone who is proud and arrogant, against everyone who considers themselves superior — they will all be humbled.

verses.kjv: And upon all the cedars of Lebanon, that are high and lifted up, and upon all the oaks of Bashan,
verses.ct: That day will come against all the tall, towering cedars of Lebanon and all the mighty oaks of Bashan,

verses.kjv: And upon all the high mountains, and upon all the hills that are lifted up,
verses.ct: against every soaring mountain and every elevated hill,

verses.kjv: And upon every high tower, and upon every fenced wall,
verses.ct: against every tall tower and every fortified wall,

verses.kjv: And upon all the ships of Tarshish, and upon all pleasant pictures.
verses.ct: against all the trading ships of Tarshish and every beautiful vessel.

verses.kjv: And the loftiness of man shall be bowed down, and the haughtiness of men shall be made low: and the LORD alone shall be exalted in that day.
verses.ct: Human pride will be brought down, and the arrogance of people will be crushed. The LORD alone will be honored on that day.

verses.kjv: And the idols he shall utterly abolish.
verses.ct: The idols will completely disappear.

verses.kjv: And they shall go into the holes of the rocks, and into the caves of the earth, for fear of the LORD, and for the glory of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.
verses.ct: People will crawl into caves in the rocks and holes in the ground, fleeing from the terrifying presence of the LORD and the splendor of his majesty when he rises to shake the earth.

verses.kjv: In that day a man shall cast his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which they made each one for himself to worship, to the moles and to the bats;
verses.ct: On that day, people will throw away the silver and gold idols they made for themselves to worship — they will toss them to the moles and bats.

verses.kjv: To go into the clefts of the rocks, and into the tops of the ragged rocks, for fear of the LORD, and for the glory of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.
verses.ct: They will scramble into cracks in the cliffs and crevices in the jagged rocks, fleeing from the terrifying presence of the LORD and the splendor of his majesty when he rises to shake the earth.

verses.kjv: Cease ye from man, whose breath is in his nostrils: for wherein is he to be accounted of ?
verses.ct: Stop putting your trust in mere humans, who have nothing more than breath in their lungs. What are they really worth?
